column4: Ok. I'm only mildly annoyed that 12.04 installed dnsmasq w/o telling me, and broke my pdns setup and took me a while to figure out why one machine was working but the others weren't
My actual question though is.  dnsmasq has --listen-address=127.0.0.1
where is that set so I can change it
yeah it can help but can cause isues
I had pdnsd set, and it could not longer start since dnsmasq had swiped the port
I don't mind trying dnsmasq, I just want to know where it is configured so I can rebind it to the external interface
there is no dnsmasq.conf anywhere.
and a grep in init.d does not reveal any mention of dnsmasq
/etc/dnsmasq.conf
yeah. no
although I see /var/run/nm-dns-dnsmasq.conf in the startup line
I doubt that'll let me override the commandline param though. I'd like to know how the service is being started
doesn't look like /etc/NetworkManager/NetworkManager.conf lets one configure it either. only disable it
why do they do this sort of stuff and not tell people.
hm. looks like it creates that config on the fly. grrr.
there is a how to in order to disable it
ok. does *anyone* know how to change this dnsmasq in 12.04 from using 127.0.0.1 to eth0
